text: Albert I (Albert Honoré Charles Grimaldi; 13 November 1848 – 26 June 1922) was Prince of Monaco from 10 September 1889 until his death in 1922. While he was prince, he also focused on oceanography, exploration and science. Albert died on 26 June 1922 in Paris, France, and was succeeded by his son, Louis II. ==References== Category:1848 births Category:1922 deaths Category:Princes and princesses of Monaco Category:Scientists from Paris Category:Writers from Paris Category:Oceanographers
title: Albert I, Prince of Monaco
